thread.title: Pilot's survival 'amazing' as helicopter crashes in remote forest in Ruapehu district
thread.title_full: Pilot's survival 'amazing' as helicopter crashes in remote forest in Ruapehu district

author: Talia Shadwell and Ged Cann
title: Pilot's survival 'amazing' as helicopter crashes in remote forest in Ruapehu district
text:
Pilot's survival 'amazing' as helicopter crashes in remote forest in Ruapehu district TALIA SHADWELL AND GED CANN Last updated 14:34, February 19 2017 
A pilot was transporting beehives when he survived a helicopter crash in the remote Ruapehu district. 
The pilot, who was the only person on board, has been taken to hospital in a serious condition, police said. 
The helicopter went down in the Waimarino Forest near the Raetihi area, Ruapehu, on Sunday morning. 
Ruapehu District Council chief executive Clive Manley said the pilot had been in one of two helicopters flying over the remote area, and crashed about 9.30am. 
Police were with his family and supporting them at this distressing time, they said. 
The Fire Service received notification of the incident at 9:36am on Sunday. 
The Transport Accident Investigation Commission (TAIC) will investigate the crash. 
Ruapehu mayor Don Cameron said it was "amazing" to receive news the pilot had survived the crash, following last week's tragedy involving a helicopter pilot and former SAS soldier who crashed and died fighting the major Christchurch fire. 
"We've all had our hearts in our mouths since Steve Askin came down in the Port Hills." 
He did not know much detail of Sunday's crash, but said the area where the helicopter came down was "extremely remote" and difficult to get to by land. 
Cameron said at this time of year there tended to be a lot of work moving Manuka honey bee hives by air in the region.
